lenders.loan_because: I can.

John Perry Barlow

lenders.name: Bharat
lenders.loan_because: A little money from America goes a long way in some parts of the world...because Kiva combines the best of idealism and basic humanity with the brilliance of MFI to make a great impact on people's lives all over the world...Long live social entrepreneurship!!!
lenders.occupational_info: I am a teacher, a tutor, a researcher and soon to be graduate student. What little money I have I spend on survival, but I am about to save more to spend on Kiva...

lenders.name: janice
lenders.loan_because: I think this is a wonderful gift of hope.
lenders.occupational_info: High School Wellness Education Administrator (Health and Physical Education)

lenders.name: Bernhard
lenders.loan_because:
I loan primarily to loan groups with people who have independent purposes for their loans, not just a single business, offer a group guarantee, and live in countries that are below HDI (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_Development_Index) 150. I may make exceptions to this rule.

The reason why I loan is that the categorical imperative (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Categorical_imperative) demands that you cannot rely on the government alone to support people in developing countries.
lenders.occupational_info:
I write books and articles for the Wikimedia Foundation, which are then made available for free.
(For example http://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/Parent_Education_Course_Writer's_Guide)

lenders.name: Stefan
lenders.loan_because: I can

lenders.name: Myra
lenders.loan_because: I care

lenders.name: Marco Antonio
lenders.loan_because: It´s important to give something back, to involve more with the world around us
lenders.occupational_info: Election bureau in Mexico, also poetry selections

lenders.name: Sheryl
lenders.loan_because: I have been inspired by my dad, Gene Dunlap, to take a look around and share the wealth.  My dad always encouraged me to pay attention to the positive and move past the negative.  I hope to set an example that will encourage others to think positively and to believe in their own strength as my dad did for me.

lenders.name: Mark
lenders.loan_because: I feel grateful to be able to share my resources with others in a way that contributes to a better world.

lenders.name: Philip
lenders.loan_because: I like to help.

lenders.occupational_info: I am trying to follow Jesus, and am a nurse by profession. I try to receive God's Kingdom on earth, and sharing wealth is one way of doing that.

lenders.loan_because: I would like to help families throughout the world enhance their quality of life and help fund better education for the children.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a married mother of three boys. We are involved in agriculture, raising cattle. The boys help my husband and I with the family ranch. I am also employed as asixth grade teacher. My day begins well before the sun comes up doing chores and milking my cow. I then set out for school which is 45 minutes away. I enjoy teaching through the day and return home in the evening to milk once again. Weekends are very busy working on the ranch taking care of the cattle ensuring that all their needs are met.

lenders.name: for my sister
lenders.loan_because: We are all connected to each other.

lenders.name: Anna

lenders.loan_because: KIVA makes it so easy to let us bridge the gap between the poverty cycle and empowering personal development.

lenders.name: Ariel
lenders.loan_because: we gotta invest in each other!
lenders.occupational_info: I study history because I want to be able to teach young people about the past.

lenders.name: Bruce
lenders.loan_because: I am not a wealthy person. After I pay my bills my wife and I must be careful with the money we have left. Before Kiva, I believed we could loan a little, if it would help, but I didn't think our few dollars would be of use to anyone. We felt powerless to change the world, in any way. Kiva has given me hope that the efforts of even a few people, pooling our little capital does can change the world. I pray that the pooled pennies of an ever growing community of lenders will empower our clients. I pray our borrowers will prosper and become lenders so that their neighbors also may succeed. I loan because I am a crazy optomist who prays the pennies Kiva members suffer to share in loans sends a powerful message to everyone. The world can be a big dangerous place with lots of hate, prejudice, greed and wars. I hope the message people get is your best bet when you need a friend is the person, or organization that treated you like a friend, even though you were a stranger.
lenders.occupational_info: Disabled

lenders.name: Kate
lenders.loan_because: it is an easy way to make an impact on those who are less fortunate than myself, who are actively trying to better themselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach children math, reading, writing, science, and social studies.

lenders.name: Adam

lenders.occupational_info:
I (Amanda) am studying architecture in graduate school. I want to build better buildings and better cities that will have the lasting ability to improve the quality of people's lives.

I (Karen) am a librarian. I love helping people get access to information. I'm also a gardener, and I'm currently really looking forward to our summer crop of tomatoes.

lenders.occupational_info: My name is Melissa, I live in Sonoma, California, and I'm 13 years of age. I go an amazing youth group ran by John Casciani and looking foward to helping others through kiva.

lenders.loan_because: I know that I can not help everyone in this world who needs it, but I believe that we are obligated to help when it is in our power to do so, and I can do this.

I feel that loaning is an effective and dignified way to help hard-working people develop the resources that will enable them to transform their lives and their communities -  and that is a wonderful thing to be part of.    What can I say? I have a very smart son!

who is look for loan to launch  Food value chain program that benefit food grower farmers.

lenders.name: First Plymouth UCC
lenders.loan_because: The mission of the Ministry of Christian Outreach is to engage the members and friends of First Plymouth in endeavors that promote and support human dignity and social, economic, and environmental justice.
lenders.occupational_info: First Plymouth Congregational Church is home to thoughtful and progressive Christians. We offer a creative, diverse, and welcoming environment that supports all individuals and families.

lenders.name: Fajar
lenders.loan_because: I need To Build Cellular and Computer Bussines.
lenders.occupational_info: I have a talent to work with mobile phone repair (hardware/software). computer Repair (PC - Apple Computer).

lenders.name: Kyle
lenders.loan_because: eh, time to do some good.
lenders.occupational_info: I am partners in a company that buys, sells and repairs telephone equipment.

lenders.name: Naveed
lenders.loan_because: I am greatly  inspired by Muhammad Yunus . They call him the "banker of the poor." the Bangladeshi economist who pioneered a new category of banking known as micro-credit, which grants small loans to poor people who have no collateral and who do not qualify for conventional bank loans."No one is more motivated than the poor to get out of poverty"
lenders.occupational_info: In any situation the greatest good you can do is your best. I believe that when you know you are doing your best, regardless of what happens to you that is beyond your control, you will be able to retain a pervasive sense of inner peace. You can ask for nothing more than to be doing your very best at this particular moment in time. If you have that, you want for nothing. And if you want for nothing, the natural consequence is peace.

lenders.name: Mary-Anne
lenders.loan_because: It is so easy for me to make a difference to someone who really needs the help. And it is exciting.
lenders.occupational_info: I help people buy and sell their homes, and I also help with their Wills and estates.

lenders.name: Jenny
lenders.loan_because: "Give a person a fish, they eat for a day, teach them how to fish, they eat for a lifetime."  I would like to empower people to eat for a lifetime.

lenders.name: Bryony
lenders.loan_because: I care

Credit, capital has to be provided to help a business expand and grow. That's why I proud to loan, because my money to put to work helping people achieve their buisness potentials.

lenders.loan_because: I love to help people

lenders.name: Ajay

lenders.name: Ivan

lenders.occupational_info: I'd rather not...

lenders.name: Catherine
lenders.loan_because: I won the cosmic lottery being alive in the US at this time and with the family and skills I have and would like to share my good fortune with others.
lenders.occupational_info: At the moment I believe I have enough money lent that I'm just letting the repayments build up and then re-lend them. So far I have almost lent twice the amount of money I've put into Kiva!

lenders.name: steve
lenders.occupational_info:
I like to work hard and play hard,living by the sea and Dartmoor let's me do this, I am running a business selling adult lingerie and toy's.go to the site and check it out. It might not be for everyone but pass it on to others it WILL be appreciated. There is also a "buy it now" auction site I use,

http://www.cqout.com/list.asp?seller=chalkie101


There are over 900 items to choose from so there should be something for everyone. This is my favourite place, from order to delivery was only 4 day’s can’t get better.

http://www.cocoadultfun.co.uk

Happy shopping

Steve

lenders.name: Carrie & Christian
lenders.loan_because: my ship has brought thousands of tons of grain to people in need and I am told that a large portion of it gets stolen or misused. I feel this program will allow our donations to be more effective.

lenders.name: b_boy
lenders.loan_because: i want people to have the same opportunities available to me

lenders.name: Social Justice Team
lenders.loan_because: We must use the gifts and talents we have been given to stand in solidarity with those on the margins of society.
lenders.occupational_info: The Social Justice Team seeks to discover, explore and embody our Christian call to radical, Christ-like love. We are rooted in the Scripture and our rich tradition of Catholic Social Teachings. We connect what we experience at Mass to how we live by serving the common good through works of mercy for the poor and vulnerable as well as working to eliminate the conditions that create the need for charity by advocating for just social policy and education of ourselves and the community.

lenders.name: Linda
lenders.loan_because: I am blessed enough to be able to now
lenders.occupational_info: I teach 6 -7 year olds math, literacy, science, and social studies

lenders.name: Ellis

lenders.name: Judi
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people become self-sufficient and be able to provide for their families. I love Jesus, and this is a way I can show His love to others.

lenders.name: Michelle
lenders.loan_because: I want to support the many men and women who see beyond the hard times and try to make their lives better.
lenders.occupational_info: I make computers, machines and other technologies easier to use for everyday people.

lenders.name: Marie

Unless someone like you cares a whole awful lot, nothing is going to get better.  It's not.  ~Dr. Seuss

Nobody can do everything, but everyone can do something.  ~Author Unknown

lenders.name: Hoja

I read books and pass tests!

lenders.occupational_info: I am happiest when my life is filled with diversity. So, it is natural (and normal) for me to  work in health care AND be a writer of self help and  motivational articles. I also have a website and publish a monthly newsletter.
